Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Class BridgingIndexProgressor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.api.index.BridgingIndexProgressor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, IndexProgressor, IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
    public class BridgingIndexProgressor
extends Object
implements IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient, IndexProgressor
    Combine multiple progressor to act like one single logical progressor seen from client's perspective.

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Description copied from interface: IndexProgressor
        Progress through the index until the next accepted entry. Entries are feed to a Client, which is setup in an implementation specific way.
        Specified by:
        next in interface IndexProgressor
        Returns:
        true if an accepted entry was found, false otherwise

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(IndexDescriptor descriptor,
                       IndexProgressor progressor,
                       IndexQuery[] queries,
                       IndexQueryConstraints constraints,
                       boolean indexIncludesTransactionState)
        Description copied from interface: IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
        Setup the client for progressing using the supplied progressor. The values feed in accept map to the propertyIds provided here. Called by index implementation.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor
        progressor - The progressor
        queries - The query of this progression
        constraints - Constraints on the produced results, like the required order the index should return entity ids in, or if the index should fetch property values together with entity ids.
        indexIncludesTransactionState - true if the index takes transaction state into account such that the entities delivered through IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient.acceptEntity(long, float, Value...) have already been filtered through, and merged with, the transaction state. If this is true, then the client does not need to do its own transaction state filtering. This is the case for the fulltext schema indexes, for instance. Otherwise, if this parameter is false, then the client needs to filter and merge the transaction state in on their own.

      • assertKeysAlign

        private void assertKeysAlign​(int[] keys)

      • acceptEntity

        public boolean acceptEntity​(long reference,
                            float score,
                            Value... values)
        Description copied from interface: IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
        Accept the node id and values of a candidate index entry. Return true if the entry is accepted, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        acceptEntity in interface IndexProgressor.EntityValueClient
        Parameters:
        reference - the node id of the candidate index entry
        score - a score figure for the quality of the match, for indexes where this makes sense, otherwise Float.NaN.
        values - the values of the candidate index entry
        Returns:
        true if the entry is accepted, false otherwise
